raw_text:
Tautou film tops Cesar prize nods
 
 French film A Very Long Engagement has received 12 nominations for France's Cesar film awards, despite a recent ruling it was "not French enough".
 
 The World War I romantic drama starring Audrey Tautou, was recently ruled "too American" by a Paris court as it was partially backed by Warner Bros. But the Cesar organisers modified their rules to allow the film to compete. The film, directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet, received best actress, picture and director nominations.
 
 Last November a court judged the film was too American to compete in French film festivals. Two associations of French producers challenged Jeunet's right to French government subsidies, because Warner Bros was a backer. The ruling meant the movie - which was filmed in France and used French actors and technicians - was not eligible to compete for French prizes. But Alain Terzian, president of Cesar organisers, the Academie des Arts et Techniques du Cinema, said the changes in eligibility rules, which allow films "of French expression", were made three months prior to the court decision. Other films in the best film category include Police drama 36, Quai Des Orfevres, Arnaud Desplechin's Kings And Queen, Abdellatif Kechiche's L'Esquive and France's number one film at the 2004 box-office The Chorus.
 
 Best actors are Daniel Auteuil for 36, Mathieu Amalric for Kings And Queen, Gerard Jugnot for The Chorus, Philippe Torreton for L'Equipier and Benoit Poelvoorde for Podium. Tautou will compete against Maggie Cheung , Emmanuelle Devos, Yolande Moreau and Karin Viard for best actress. Michael Moore's Fahrenheit 9/11, The Motorcycle Diaries, Lost in Translation, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and 21 Grams are all vying in the best foreign film prize. The awards ceremony will be held on 26 February. This year, Will Smith, star of I, Robot, Independence Day and Men In Black, will be given an honorary Cesar, along with French singer/actor, Jacques Dutronc.
llama3.2:1b: Audrey Tautou's film "A Very Long Engagement" received 12 nominations for the France Cesar awards despite a recent ruling that it was not "French enough".
The film, directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet, won best actress and director nominations.
A Paris court ruled the film too American to compete in French film festivals, but changes were made allowing it to participate.

The Cesar organisers modified their rules to allow the film to compete, and it is now nominated for best actress, picture, and director alongside other films including Kings And Queen and L'Esquive.
gemma2:2b: The film "A Very Long Engagement" has received 12 nominations for the French César Awards despite a court ruling stating it was "too American."
The film's eligibility for the awards was altered to include films of "French expression," allowing it to compete.
Other notable nominations include "36," "Kings and Queen," "L'Esquive," and "The Chorus."
Audrey Tautou is nominated for best actress, while Michael Moore is vying for best foreign film.
The César Awards ceremony will be held on February 26th.

The director, Jean-Pierre Jeunet, received a nomination in several categories including picture, actress and director.
qwen2.5:1.5b: French film "A Very Long Engagement" nominated for 12 César awards despite initial ruling it wasn't fully French; eligibility rules modified to allow its competition as a film of French expression, leading to nominations in multiple categories including best actor and director.
Other notable films include "36," "Kings And Queen," "L'Esquive," and "The Chorus."
qwen2.5:3b: French film A Very Long Engagement, starring Audrey Tautou, received 12 nominations for the César awards despite being deemed "too American" by a Paris court due to Warner Bros backing.
The film was subsequently allowed to compete after eligibility rules were modified to include films of French expression.

Nominations cover categories such as Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Actress, with Alain Terzian, Académie des Arts et Techniques du Cinéma president, emphasizing the changes in criteria to accommodate the film's inclusion.
Additionally, the ceremony includes awards for best foreign language film and an honorary César given to Will Smith and Jacques Dutronc.
opencoder:1.5b:
Tautou Film tops Cesar Prize nods

French film A Very Long Engagement has received 12 nominations for France's Cesar film awards, despite a recent ruling it was "not French enough".
The World War I romantic drama starring Audrey Tautou, was recently ruled "too American" by a Paris court as it was partially backed by Warner Bros.
The film, directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet, received best actress, picture and director nominations.
Last November a court judged the film was too American to compete in French film festivals.
Two associations of French producers challenged Jeunet's right to French government subsidies because Warner Bros was a backer.
The ruling meant the movie - which was filmed in France and used French actors and technicians - was not eligible to compete for French prizes.

Alain Terzian, president of Cesar film organisers, the Academie des Arts et Techniques du Cinema said the changes in eligibility rules, which allow films "of French expression", were made three months prior to the court decision.

Other films in the best film category include Police drama 36, Quai Des Orfevres, Arnaud Desplechin's Kings And Queen, Abdellatif Kechiche's L'Esquive and France's number one film at the 2004 box-office The Chorus.
Best actors are Daniel Auteuil for 36, Mathieu Amalric for Kings And Queen, Gerard Jugnot for The Chorus, Philippe Torreton for L'Equipier and Benoit Poelvoorde for Podium.
Tautou will compete against Maggie Cheung , Emmanuelle Devos, Yolande Moreau and Karin Viard for best actress.
Michael Moore's Fahrenheit 9/11, The Motorcycle Diaries, Lost in Translation, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and 21 Grams are all vying in the best foreign film prize.
The awards ceremony will be held on 26 February.
This year, Will Smith, star of I, Robot, Independence Day and Men In Black, will be given an honorary Cesar, along with French singer/actor, Jacques Dutronc.
smollm:1.7b: The summary is concise and to the point, preserving key ideas and details while omitting unnecessary information.
Tautou film tops Cesar prize nods - French film A Very Long Engagement has received 12 nominations for France's Cesar award, despite a recent ruling it was "not French enough".
French film A Very Long Engagement has been nominated in the best film category by the World Film Festival of Paris (Cesar) and is currently competing against other films in the same category.
Best actors are Daniel Auteuil for 36, Mathieu Amalric for Kings And Queen, Gerard Jugnot for The Chorus, Philippe Torreton for L'Equipier and Benoit Poelvoorde for Podium.
Michael Moore's Fahrenheit 9/11 is a foreign film that has been nominated in the Cesar award, but not in the best foreign film category.

Other films competing in the Best Foreign Film category include:
	* Police drama 36 (Quai Des Orfevres)
	* Quai Des Orfevres (Police drama)
	* Arnaud Desplechin's Kings And Queen (Police drama)
	* Abdellatif Kechiche's L'Esquive (Police drama)
	* France's number one film at the 2004 box-office: The Chorus (Police drama)
deepseek-r1:1.5b: The French Film Awards 2023 saw "A Very Long Engagement" as topping with 12 nominations despite a recent ruling that it was deemed not "French enough."
However, after modifying their eligibility rules, Tautou's film, directed by Jean-Pierre Jeunet and starring Audrey Tautou, qualified to compete in the awards.

The ceremony included winners from various categories: Best Film (36), Best Actress (Tautou), Best Actor (Daniel Auteuil), Best Director (Jean-Pierre Jeunet), Best Picture, Best Banker, Best Musician, Best Scientist, Best Film Direction, and Best Foreign Film, among others.
The ceremony will take place on 26 February.
tinyllama:1.1b: The French film industry has welcomed news that Cesar award nominations have been modified to allow films to compete in the Best Film category, despite concerns that they were too American.
This change came after a court ruling that initially barred the film French Film Festival entries from competing for Cesar awards.
The changes were made three months before the ruling was announced, allowing the award-winning French-language drama A Very Long Engagement to compete.

Other films in the Best Film category include Police drama 36 (which received best actor nominations), Quai Des Orfevres (which received best actress nominations for Audrey Tautou), Abdellatiif Kechiche's L'Equipier, and France's number one film at the box-office The Chorus.
Best actors are Daniel Autuillo for 36, Mathieu Amaric for Kings And Queen, Gerard Jugnot for The Chorus, Philippe Torreton for L'Equipier, and Benoit Poelvoorde for Podium.
Taron Egerton, Michael Moore's film "Fahrenheit 9/11", The Motorcycle Diaries, Lost in Translation, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, and 21 Grammes are also competing.
The Cesar ceremony will be held on February 26, with the honorary award being given to Will Smith and French singer-actor Jacques Dutronc.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Year: 2007
Roman Romanov, the heir to the Russian throne, is accused of ordering the assassination of his uncle.
The case takes a dark turn as the police reveal that the target was not an immediate threat and that there were multiple enemies in Russia capable of carrying out the deed.
A high-profile trial ensues, and Romanov's enemies, including his former bodyguards and other influential members of the Russian elite, attempt to prove their innocence by framing him for the crime.
As the plot unfolds, it becomes clear that there are multiple layers to this conspiracy and that Romanov's downfall is no simple matter.

The Oscar-winning romantic drama was recently ruled ineligible by a Paris court due to partial funding from Warner Bros.
But the award organizers modified their rules, allowing the movie to compete.
Other films in the best film category include Police drama 36 and Kings And Queen.
Best actors are Daniel Auteuil for 36, Mathieu Amalric for Kings And Queen, Gerard Jugnot for The Chorus, Philippe Torreton for L'Equipier and Benoit Poelvoorde for Podium.
Tautou will compete against other leading actresses such as Maggie Cheung, Emmanuelle Devos, Yolande Moreau, and Karin Viard.
Michael Moore's Fahrenheit 9/11 is also in competition for the best foreign film prize.
The ceremony will take place on February 26th with an honorary Cesar given to Will Smith and French singer/actor Jacques Dutronc.

The film received best actress, picture and director nominations.

Other films in the best film category include Police drama 36, Quai Des Orfevres, Arnaud Desplechin's Kings And Queen, Abdellatif Kechiche's L'Esquive and France's number one film at the 2004 box-office The Chorus.

chatgpt-4o-latest: A Very Long Engagement, a French World War I romantic drama starring Audrey Tautou, received 12 nominations for France's Cesar film awards despite a court ruling that it was "too American" due to Warner Bros.' backing.
The Cesar organisers modified their rules to allow the film to compete, and it secured nominations for best actress, picture, and director.
Other best film nominees include 36, Quai Des Orfevres, Kings And Queen, L'Esquive, and The Chorus.

Best actor nominees include Daniel Auteuil, Mathieu Amalric, Gerard Jugnot, Philippe Torreton, and Benoit Poelvoorde, while Tautou competes against Maggie Cheung, Emmanuelle Devos, Yolande Moreau, and Karin Viard for best actress.
Best foreign film contenders include Fahrenheit 9/11, The Motorcycle Diaries, Lost in Translation, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, and 21 Grams.
The awards ceremony will be held on 26 February, with Will Smith and Jacques Dutronc receiving honorary Cesars.
